summary: 賢者とは何か──欠点を指摘してくれる奴を宝の案内人として従え。岩のように動じず、深い湖のように澄み、此岸でウロウロせず彼岸に渡る者、それが賢者ってもんだ。

verses.pali:
Nidhīnaṃva pavattāraṃ
yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ
tādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje
tādisaṃ bhajamānassa
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.
verses.reading:

verses.english: Should one find a man who points out faults and who reproves, let him follow such a wise and sagacious person as one would a guide to hidden treasure. It is always better, and never worse, to cultivate such an association.
verses.sezon: 欠点を指摘し、叱ってくれる奴を見つけたら──埋蔵金の案内人に従うように、そいつについていけ。そういう付き合いは常に良くなることはあっても、悪くなることはねぇ

verses.pali:
Ovadeyyānusāseyya
asabbhā ca nivāraye
sataṃ hi so piyo hoti
asataṃ hoti appiyo.
verses.reading:
オーヴァデッヤーヌサーセッヤ
アサッバー チャ ニヴァーラエー

verses.english: Let him admonish, instruct and shield one from wrong; he, indeed, is dear to the good and detestable to the evil.
verses.sezon: 忠告し、教え導き、悪から守ってくれる奴──そいつは善人に愛され、悪人には嫌われる。嫌われるのは勲章ってもんだ

verses.pali:
Na bhaje pāpake mitte
na bhaje purisādhame
bhajetha mitte kalyāṇe
bhajetha purisuttame.
verses.reading:

verses.english: Do not associate with evil companions; do not seek the fellowship of the vile. Associate with the good friends; seek the fellowship of noble men.
verses.sezon: 悪い仲間とつるむな。卑しい奴らと群れるな。善き友と交われ。高貴な人間を求めろ

verses.pali:
Dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti
vippasannena cetasā
ariyappavedite dhamme
sadā ramati paṇḍito.
verses.reading:

アリヤッパヴェーディテー ダンメー

verses.english: He who drinks deep the Dhamma lives happily with a tranquil mind. The wise man ever delights in the Dhamma made known by the Noble One (the Buddha).
verses.sezon: 法（ダンマ）を深く飲み干した者は、澄んだ心で幸福に暮らす。賢者は聖者が説いた法を常に楽しむんだ

verses.pali:
Udakañhi nayanti nettikā
usukārā namayanti tejanaṃ
dāruṃ namayanti tacchakā
attānaṃ damayanti paṇḍitā.
verses.reading:
ウダカンヒ ナヤンティ ネッティカー
ウスカーラー ナマヤンティ テージャナン
ダールン ナマヤンティ タッチャカー

verses.english: Irrigators regulate the rivers; fletchers straighten the arrow shaft; carpenters shape the wood; the wise control themselves.
verses.sezon: 水路師は水を導き、矢師は矢を真っ直ぐにし、大工は木を削る。賢者は──自分自身を調御するんだ

verses.pali:
Selo yathā ekaghano
vātena na samīrati
evaṃ nindāpasaṃsāsu
na samiñjanti paṇḍitā.
verses.reading:

verses.english: Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the storm, even so the wise are not affected by praise or blame.
verses.sezon: 堅固な岩が嵐にビクともしねぇように──賢者は称賛にも非難にも動じねぇ

verses.pali:
Yathāpi rahado gambhīro
vippasanno anāvilo
evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna
vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

verses.english: On hearing the Teachings, the wise become perfectly purified, like a lake deep, clear and still.
verses.sezon: 深くて、澄んでいて、濁りのねぇ湖のように──教えを聞いた賢者は完全に浄化される

verses.pali:
Sabbattha ve sappurisā cajanti
na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena
na uccāvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

verses.english: The good renounce (attachment for) everything. The virtuous do not prattle with a yearning for pleasures. The wise show no elation or depression when touched by happiness or sorrow.
verses.sezon: 善人はあらゆるものへの執着を手放す。徳ある者は快楽を求めてペラペラ喋らねぇ。幸にも不幸にも触れられて──賢者は浮きも沈みもしねぇ

verses.pali:
Na attahetu na parassa hetu
na puttamicche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhimattano
sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.

verses.english: He is indeed virtuous, wise, and righteous who neither for his own sake nor for the sake of another (does any wrong), who does not crave for sons, wealth, or kingdom, and does not desire success by unjust means.
verses.sezon: 自分のためにも他人のためにも悪事を働かず、息子も財産も王国も欲しがらず、不正な手段で成功を求めねぇ──そいつが戒律あり、智慧あり、正しき者ってもんだ

verses.pali:
Appakā te manussesu
ye janā pāragāmino
athāyaṃ itarā pajā
tīramevānudhāvati.

verses.english: Few among men are those who cross to the farther shore. The rest, the bulk of men, only run up and down the hither bank.
verses.sezon: 彼岸に渡る人間なんざ少数だ。残りの大多数は──此岸をウロウロ走り回ってるだけだ

verses.pali:
Ye ca kho sammadakkhāte
dhamme dhammānuvattino
te janā pāramessanti
maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.
verses.reading:

verses.english: But those who act according to the perfectly taught Dhamma will cross the realm of Death, so difficult to cross.
verses.sezon: だが正しく説かれた法（ダンマ）に従って行動する者──そいつらは渡りがたい死の領域をブッちぎって渡るんだ

verses.pali:
Kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya
sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito
okā anokamāgamma
viveke yattha dūramaṃ.
verses.reading:

verses.english: Abandoning the dark way, let the wise man cultivate the bright path. Having gone from home to homelessness, let him yearn for that delight in detachment, so difficult to enjoy.
verses.sezon: 暗い道を捨てて、賢者よ明るい道を歩め。家を出て出家の身となり──味わうのが難しい離欲の喜びを求めろ

verses.pali:

hitvā kāme akiñcano
pariyodapeyya attānaṃ
cittaklesehi paṇḍito.

verses.english: Giving up sensual pleasures, with no attachment, let the wise man cleanse himself of defilements of the mind.
verses.sezon: 感覚の快楽をブン投げて、何も所有せず、賢者は心の汚れから自分をピカピカに洗い清めろ

verses.pali:

sammā cittaṃ subhāvitaṃ
ādānapaṭinissagge
anupādāya ye ratā
khīṇāsavā jutimanto
te loke parinibbutā.

verses.english: Those whose minds have reached full excellence in the factors of enlightenment, who, having renounced acquisitiveness, rejoice in not clinging to things — rid of cankers, glowing with wisdom, they have attained Nibbana in this very life.
verses.sezon: 覚りの要素において心を完全に修めた者、執着を手放し、何にもしがみつかねぇことを喜ぶ者──煩悩を滅ぼし、智慧で輝くそいつらは、この世にいながらにして涅槃に達してるんだ
